results.title: Methods of water rescue
results.creator_credit: Maria Boldini, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
A team of schoolboys demonstrate, both on land and in the water, methods of rescue, release and resuscitation. Shows methods of rescue for calm and struggling patients; release from the clutch of a panic-stricken patient; rescue methods for an unconscious patient; resuscitation by the Schaeffer methods; restoration of blood circulation by massage of the limbs. The film concludes with demonstration of a number of fancy swimming strokes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maria Boldini, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions

results.title: Methods of family planning
results.creator_credit: Jan Steen, John Churchill and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description: Accurately and objectively explains the human reproductive cycle and all presently practised methods of practising it are seen as a matter of personal choice. Illustrates by animation. Avoids social and moral considerations.

results.title: Method study basic principles
results.brief_description: The systematic approach to method study — the essence of which lies in the critical questioning of existing procedures and which results in increased productivity, lower unit costs, easier work and higher earnings. Case examples come from garage work, furniture and electrical manufacture and Local Government.

results.creator_credit: Catherine Mercier, Tim Wallace and Texture Films

results.title: Metamorphoses (K)
results.brief_description: An animated film about a clown who is so versatile that he even juggles himself. One moment the clown stands tossing balls, the next he becomes dismembered, following the balls about on the screen but coming together again all in one piece to finish the act. The film is in the genre of Norman McLaren and is without words.

results.title: Metamorphoses
results.creator_credit: Barry Greenwald, Conestoga College and Faroun Films
results.brief_description: A bored white collar office worker finds meaning in the 25 second elevator ride to his office. In this secret time alone, he progresses from simply undressing to his shorts (and then re-dressing) to a multitude of relaxing pass-times, all at ultrafast speed. One day the lift gets stuck and later opens to reveal a much older man apparently dead of old age. (Won Palm D’Or, Cannes, 1976.)

results.title: Metals
results.brief_description: Sir Lawrence Bragg shows the different properties of metals, illustrates their characteristics, demonstrates the crystalling structure of aluminium, and shows how the same piece of metal can have different properties according to treatment. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Metallurgist
results.creator_credit: Neville Bletcher, Broken Hill Proprietary Company and Solarchrome
results.brief_description: Describes the work of a metallurgist and depicts various activities in which his skill is needed; in particular, the manufacture and testing of tin plate.
